dialogues.text: John walks out onto the top overpass of a crumbling maze of intersecting freeways. Burnt-out husks of long- forgotten vehicles sit in rows of gridlock. A low DRONE penetrates the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she here? On the horizon is a dying RED SUN.    It strains to cut through the putrid brown haze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she here?! His VOICE REVERBERATES to infinity.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John cautiously steps closer to the railing, looks down to the ribbons of twisting streets below. They're crammed with teeming masses of the damned. All walking down in silence, faces numb with sorrow and grief.

dialogues.speaker: IS SHE HERE
dialogues.text: That low DRONE RISES IN PITCH and John now spots a huge blanket-like BLACKNESS crawling over the cityscape, rapidly closing in on him. You get the feeling this isn't a safe place for the living.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a simple question!    Is she here or not?!! John suddenly locks on something far off. On top of a distant skyscraper is a FEMALE FIGURE in a sheer white gown. John can't make out her face but knows she's looking right at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel? She lifts something and tosses it. John watches as a small object tumbles toward him just ahead of closing darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that same motion we left her in -- Angela finishes pushing the door closed. As it LATCHES --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weakly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela... come back in... Confused, Angela pushes the door back open. Cat BOLTS out. Angela catches her breath, moves inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits slumped in the chair, drained. Steam rises off his skin. Angela sees the water in the bucket has almost all boiled out. She walks in, kneels down to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?     What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sweat drips off as he looks up. He opens his palm -- reveals to Angela a simple HOSPITAL BAND. The name "ISABEL DODSON" is typed on it. Even as a semi-convert, this news completely floors Angela. She takes the plastic band -- grips it tight -- tries to hold herself together. The adrenaline and pain overwhelm. Her knee buckle and she drops to the floor. John watches, isn't sure how to help. He finally reaches out a single hand -- slowly rests it on her shoulder. The contact seems to open a floodgate of emotion and Angela falls right into his arms. John hasn't been this close to anyone in a long time. Angela finally composes herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?   How did you do this...? John tries not to stare into those eyes too long.     Fai

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Body drawer slides open -- reveals Isabel. Lying in a cold, sterile room of death. A Hell of a different type. Hennessey stares down at her, looks around the room again, makes sure he's still alone. He reaches in, rips open the protective plastic and lowers his hand inside. Places it first on her forehead. Nothing. Then on her chest. Nothing. Wrist is last. Hennessey shudders. This is it. He closes his eyes and opens himself to the void --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, I saw things...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: A TEN-YEAR-OLD John comes out of a corner store with milk in a bag. He slows, eyes a MAN at a mailbox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things I wasn't supposed to. The man looks right at young John as he passes. His face is distorted and his feet have sprouted roots which are dug into the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee? Young John looks up toward the voice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John looks up at the Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tea. She leaves. Angela sits across from him.      They're at table by the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My parents sent me to a doctor, a shrink, a priest. I was in four different institutions by the time I was eighteen. Angela notes him rubbing his wrist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The last place they put me was run by a church... A DOCTOR rushes past their table.     PAN WITH him INTO..

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: The Doctor rushes toward distant SCREAMING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The revered Father made the brilliant deduction that I was possessed, said I needed to be exorcised...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Doctor runs in. Sees the revered Father below, leaning over a bed where an 18-year-old John is held down by three interns and that Doctor. John angrily screams at them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was like someone trying to pull teeth that weren't there. Young John clamps his eyes shut tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Present-day John does the same, remembering the pain. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I took things into my own hands and I found a way out. ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You attempted suicide. John sees she's looking at his wrist. The hint of a jagged scar can now be seen under the sleeve. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never attempt anything. John's reflection in the window becomes --

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: kneeling with a pair off scissors.     He's inside a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teenage John looks up at a room filled with people from all walks of life. Teachers, doctors, lawyers, garbage men. All somewhat different than normal. They sit in school chairs and wait for John to do the deed. He puts the blade to his wrist -- one swipe and the world around him accelerates away in a STREAKED BLUR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're still here.    Alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not my doing. His chest suddenly HEAVES forward -- and we're on...

dialogues.speaker: FLASHBACK
dialogues.text: as he's jolted by DEFIB PADS.     He's in the back of a..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paramedics are soaked in sweat. One looks a bit like a young Dr. Archer. Heart monitor is FLAT LINE. There's little hope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ambulance moves through a city that is transforming. From this world's Los Angeles to a barren Hell version. JOHN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officially I was dead for seven minutes. But believe me, seven minutes in Hell is a lifetime. Ambulance heads toward that dying RED SUN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLAT LINE on the monitor suddenly SPIKES with a pulse --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hennessey's hand jerks back from the plastic. His eyes fix on Isabel's wrist. That odd circular SYMBOL is back. Hennessey's unsettled, quickly shoves the drawer closed. He rushes out, slams right into a SECURITY GUARD coming in. SECURITY GUARD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what're you doing in here? Guard looks back into the body room, sees a drawer partially open. He walks over, pulls it out further -- sees the plastic cut away. Jesus. The symbol has already faded from Isabel's wrist. JOHN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I returned I didn't just see demons anymore, I could do the one thing they couldn't -- come and go as I please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: runs as fast as a very obese man can -- aiming for that PHONE BOOTH on the corner. He grabs the receiver, punches numbers as fast as he can. RING -- RING --

dialogues.speaker: RING --
dialogues.text: HENNESSEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be there, John... please... Something shivers up Hennessey's leg and into his body. Eyes glaze over and Hennessey settles on a RESTAURANT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heaven and Hell are right here, behind every wall, every face -- the world behind the world. It's crossing over that's the real trick. That's why most demons can only whisper in our ears. But even a whisper can turn your favorite pleasure into your worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HENNESSEY barges in, squeezes past the MAITRE D'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you need a reservation! But Hennessey is on a quest.     For food.   And it's everywhere. He starts grabbing meals right off of plates. Fish, pasta, prime rib. Shovels it all in. Patrons are yelling -- screaming. He's eating as if his life depended on it. And even though he's devouring anything in sight, this huge man is wasting away before our eyes. In the middle of all this chaos is one customer calmly eating his meal. Balthazar. Hennessey hijacks a food cart -- consumes everything on it yet his skin is getting looser and the body inside gets thinner. He grabs a steak from a woman's plate but she jerks it back so he bites into his arm. She screams as her husband pulls her away. Hennessey's strength is withering away. Desperate, he grabs a FORK, digs it into his own hand. A Hispanic BUSBOY rushes into the room, grabs onto Hennessey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the worst demons are the ones that are allowed to be here -- the ones that are half-human so they blend in... Balthazar stands, throws a few bills on the table and starts toward the back EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... just like those with the angel's touch living alongside of us. The half-breeds. That Busboy lowers Hennessey to the floor. For a moment we see him framed against the front doorway. And in that instant we get a brief glimpse of --

dialogues.speaker: ALTERNATE LOS ANGELES
dialogues.text: An incredible pristine lake reflecting a city of light.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: BUSBOY looks up, meets Balthazar's eyes. Bitter enemies. Balthazar grins, flips that coin between his fingers. He leaves out the back exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They call it 'the Balance.' I call it hypocritical bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So when one of them gets a little cocky, peddles their influence or hijacks a soul -- I deport their scaly ass right back to Hell. (takes a sip of tea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get them all but maybe enough to insure my retirement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like you're trying to buy your way into Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what would you do if you were sentenced to a prison where half the inmates were put there by you? Not a serene image at all.     Angela studies him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you? I mean many go to Hell, why were you able to escape?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sips tea)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God has a plan for all of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not for me. John's bitterness is obvious.     Angela just stares at him -- finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel saw things too. John looks up. Moment is lost when her CELLULAR RINGS. The cop in her reacts, flips it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Dodson here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The morgue is seen across the street.     The Guard that chased Hennessey is just outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security Guard spotted him near the body, chased him out. We MOVE PAST Angela standing with Weiss.       Around the a complete shambles of fine dining --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He comes over here, makes a run at the entire menu and pow -- deflates like a fricken Macy's day balloon. -- COME TO REST ON John's shattered face. He stares down at Hennessey. Now yards of loose flesh sunken over an assemblage of bones. Only that ragged black tie he wore is familiar now. John leans down to the remains of his friend. A cop starts to intervene but Angela blocks him. Let him be. John has trouble taking this in, reluctantly reaches into Hennessey's coat pocket -- finds the protective amulet he himself removed from his friend. That's even more crushing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit... (sympathetic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you call me, you fat sonna bitch... John lowers his head, then spots blood stains on one of Hennessey's hands. He opens the fingers, studies the fork wound. The blood is already drying over it. John reaches over to the mess of dishes on the floor and grabs a melting ice cube. He pushes it into Hennessey's hand, wiping away the dried blood. It quickly becomes apparent -- this isn't random stabbings. This is a shape. John takes a napkin, lays it on the palm and presses. Residual blood creates a symbol onto the napkin. It's the same circular symbol we saw on Isabel's wrist. John doesn't know what it is, but he knows it's important

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Hennessey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rest in peace, Father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a loud crowd and 20 huge PIN MACHINES GRINDING AWAY the noise back here is DEAFENING. But this is Beeman's home. See the desk, the TV. The fold-away bed. Beeman is on the phone. There's a conversation but it's way too noisy to hear. All we see are the emotions on Beeman's face. No doubt news of Hennessey's death is one of the biggies. Beeman quickly reaches for a marker, puts it to paper and starts drawing -- listening and drawing -- He's finished, hangs up. Stares at the Symbol. That cabinet with the ancient books now gets his attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to see where Isabel died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Graffiti-adorned walls give way to a tall iron fence, heavily-shadowed grounds and finally the six-story hospital complex of RAVENSCAR.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A rim-lit figure stands on the roof. But this one isn't wearing a hospital gown, he's wearing a trench coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seances, crystals -- channeling... Our father thought she was just trying to get attention. She certainly did that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela stands behind John. A large water tank is anchored to the roof next to her. Note the FLAME logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She'd tell everyone about things she said she saw. Crazy things. Things that hadn't happened yet. She'd scare my mother to death, talking on and on about Revelations and the end of the world. Then one day she just stopped... never said another word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you put her in here. Angela doesn't need to be reminded.     It hurts even mor

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me her room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Angela head toward Isabel's room. A NURSE appears from around the corner walking with a boy. It's Barry, the boy in the courtyard. He locks on Angela and when she makes eye contact he breaks away from the Nurse, runs toward her with arms outstretched.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry! He runs right into Angela's arms, hugs her tight. Angela is totally baffled. John is thoroughly intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God...

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She rushes in, gently tugs the boy away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Barry, that's not Isabel. Barry stares at Angela. He reaches out, touches her face, confused. Nurse pulls him back even further.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. They were friends. He kind of had a crush on your sister. Angela nods, understanding. The Nurse leads Barry away. He doesn't take his eyes off Angela the entire time. Neither does John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were twins. Angela nods, steps inside.      John pauses, thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John steps inside, gives the sterile room a thorough scan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two months. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time. He pulls out a drawer, looks at the bottom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already did all that. John runs his hands under the steel bed frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're insulting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't walk off a building without leaving something behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You saw everything she left behind. In that box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she left something else. Something more personal. Just for you. Angela doesn't like that look he's giving her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were her twin, Angela.    Twins tend to think alike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not like my sister.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you were at once time. When you were kids. When you'd spend every waking hour with each other. You'd start a sentence, she'd finish it. You'd get hurt, she'd cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kind of bond doesn't just disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's nothing here. Angela seems unbalanced.     John gets more aggressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She planned her death in this room, she thought it up right where you're standing -- Angela backs away.     John advances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew you'd come -- She counted on you to see what she saw, to feel what she felt -- to do what she did. What did she do, Angela?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did she do, Angela?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you do? Angela backs into a wall.       Nowhere else to go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you leave her? What would it be? Where would it be?! Where would it be? Angela lashes out, shoves John hard, pushing him out of her way. She turns to the window, almost hyperventilating John stays back, watches. Angela opens her eyes. The tension seems to flow right out of her when she sees --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lone tree stands in the center of the lit courtyard. John and Angela approach it. Examine it. Nothing. John drops lower on the tree, to a child's height.   Finally sees something near the ground, gestures to Angela. She kneels down next to him, sees what he sees. That same SYMBOL. The one Hennessey carved into his hand. But this time there's more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to rationalize)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There must have been a tree in our backyard... when we were kids... John may not be buying it but he's not saying anything. His fingers trace these words carved below the symbol --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinthians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no 14h act in Corinthians. John's face goes pale --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several families sit in solemn prayer. The pastor comforts a man and wife. John and Angela slip through, head for the shelves of reference books on the back wall. They whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corinthians goes to 21 acts in the book of Ethenius. It's like a dark mirror of the Bible. It paints a different view of Revelations, says that the world will not come to an end at the hand of God but be reborn in the embrace of the damned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a difference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Depends on which side of the fence you're standing. John stops, casually sticks his hand in the pastor's bowl of holy water near the altar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why haven't I seen this book before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it doesn't exist here on this side. John closes his eyes and the water in the bowl begins to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean -- Flickering candlelight slows to a stop, catching Angela mid-question and the room in that dim half-light. John turns and is inside --

dialogues.speaker: SAME CHAPEL
dialogues.text: The epitome of blasphemy -- A church in Hell. Only they don't worship God in here. And that's not Christ on the cross. And those stained glass windows are now slate black. John is now facing books with completely different markings. He searches as a DRONE rises in pitch and an INKY BLACKNESS begins to flow down the walls, getting closer to John with each heartbeat. He finds the book, steps back as he closes his eyes --

dialogues.speaker: REGULAR CHAPEL
dialogues.text: ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- not here on this side? John turns, covered in sweat. He's holding a book she's never seen, is already flipping through it. ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did that come from? JOHN (stopping to read)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 13:29. 13:30 -- Here... Corinthians 14:01... (skimming to this)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The sins of the father would only be exceeded by the ego of the son.' ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose son? John stands, his brain going into overdrive. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Symbol isn't a demon's... that's why I couldn't place it... not a normal possession... ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, what are you talking about? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he can't cross over -- impossible for the son to cross over... ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose son?   God's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  The other one. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucifer had a son too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beeman sits under the glow of a desk lamp. The narrow alley of machines stretches out behind him. He stares into the scrolls -- an ancient book with a single page folded a thousand times. Turns another page.

dialogues.speaker: BOWLING AREA
dialogues.text: Amazing how disturbing a bowling alley is when it's closed. Rows of empty lanes stretching into darkness, the unlit pin areas looking like the jaws of an army of beasts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my...

dialogues.speaker: BEHIND THE LANES
dialogues.text: Beeman has stopped turning pages. That's because he's now staring at an etching of the same symbol. Below are ink drawings of a ghastly beast rising up through a body. But it's what's above the beast that is most troubling. A figure on a cross -- his arms outstretched -- seemingly welcoming the beast into this world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not good... BOWLING BALL hits a lane.     Beeman spins to the sound. BALL ROLLS round and round, closer and closer until it CLANGS dead against the back wall of one of the lanes. Beeman gets up, starts down the corridor of dormant pin machines. He stops at lane 13, leans way way down, past the machinery and peeks out the pin hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela's SUV races quickly through traffic while John gets her up to speed. JOHN (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The myth says Mammon was conceived before his father's fall from grace but was born after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But unlike his old man, he's never been in the presence of the Creator so he has no fear of him, no respect either. That goes double for us -- God's most prized creations. Mammon would be the last demon we'd ever want crossing over. ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But demons can't come and go, that's what you said. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless they found a bridge. (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some psychic with the chops to reach all the way to Hell and the grit to withstand whatever shit she'd pull out. ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Isabel... JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But even a bridge wouldn't help Mammon. Because to cross over, the myth says he'd still need the one thing he could never get. Divine assistance. The help of God. Angela sits back, letting that sink in. ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it's impossible. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible? Sure it's impossible. That's what makes it so dangerous. These things exist to break the rules, to find the loopholes. If the past is any indication, then the future isn't on our side.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John sits back, gut churning.       Angela's in detective ANGELA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knew. That's why she killed herself. But it doesn't make sense...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Makes sense to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, she sacrificed herself to beat him. John nods.     Your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why is she in Hell? One of those rare moments where John has no answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something small and SHINY is rolling down the alley. lands in the trough, spins round and round -- Beeman leans out to try and see what it is.      The silv object keeps spinning. He waits for it to stop, swats a fly near his face. another. Book on his desk ignites in flame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUV pulls into the empty parking lot. John is out before Angela gets it in park, unlocks the side door. A few flies escape to freedom as he opens the door. John rushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only a LOW HUM pervades the dead stillness of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beeman? John grabs the door that leads behind the pin area. locked from the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pounds on door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Beeman? Beeman?! The LOW HUM fluctuates -- sounds like a BUZZING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe he's not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's always here. Several more flies flit by him. This time John notices, turns and spots the source of the HUM -- a cloud of FLIES near the center aisles. Angela follows his gaze, spots them as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? John heads across the lanes. Swarm gets thicker and thicker. Angela keeps up with him, covers her mouth. They approach the pin area of the center lane. The source of the swarm is slowly revealed. In the catch trough is a solid mound of flies. John leans closer, spots a HAND protruding from the mound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus, no -- He rips his coat off, flings it at the mound and million flies scatter -- revealing the body of Beeman. Ravaged. Flies pouring out of his mouth, his ears --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stepping back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh God -- John goes ballistic, screams to the walls --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! Answer me!! Goddamit -- reveal yourself!   I summon you! He angrily rips his sleeves up -- revealing two distinct TATTOOS on his forearms. Slams them together with all his might -- clenching his eyes tight -- concentrating -- Veins in his arms and neck bulge, look ready to explode -

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela steps back in awe as the air around his outstretched arms begins to WARP -- to tear a faint hole from the bowling alley right into another world right here -- darker -- Hellish --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the light I command thee!! Into the light I -- John is choked by a cough -- can't finish -- arms separate and he buckles to his knees, reveals to Angela just how ill he really is. She leans down to him, sees hints of blood on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... this is my fault... I sent them in... I sent them right to their deaths... a damn one-man plague.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, you need a doctor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've seen a goddamn doctor!! Angela glares at him -- understands now.       He's dying John stands, almost stumbles.       Angela tries to help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from me!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay the hell away -- (tortured look to her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- He uses the handrail to walk away. Angela stands there, confused by her own emotions. She turns back to the carnage, hears the distant SIRENS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John sits in his opened window, simmering. He holds a lit cigarette but doesn't dare put it to his lips. Outside the city goes about its unending churn.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Down on the street are several police vehicles. ENGINES START and they drive away. Swirl of blue and red lights flash across John's moist eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were no trees in our back yard. John finds Angela across the room in his doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you knew that already, didn't you? John meets her eyes.     Sees the questions piling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking towards him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see something in me... Something Isabel had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go home, Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to understand -- John just shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you open up to that world, you're inviting whatever's out there back in. That's what happened to Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not Isabel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she embraced her gift while you denied yours and that denial is exactly why you're still alive. Stick with me, that'll change. John gets off the window, starts walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't need another ghost following me around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, John -- they killed my sister! That stops him cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't let them get away with that. Even if it means going down the same path she did. Now if you won't help me get there, I'll find my own way. But I won't run. Never. The two stand there -- locked in this moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... John can't believe this day -- looks her dead in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do this, there's no turning back. You see them -- they see you. Understand? Angela never blinks as she nods in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pushing slowly through a lifeless apartment -- drawing closer to the opened bathroom door. WATER is pouring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I take off my clothes or leave them on? (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On is fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John fills a 70-year-old porcelain BATHTUB.       Angela stands in the center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why water?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the universal conduit. Lubricates the transition from one plane to another. Now ask me if there's water in Hell. John turns off the faucet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit. Angela grabs his shoulder for balance, lowers herself. When she's sitting, the water is all the way to her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally only a portion of the body has to be suspended but you wanted the crash course...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (teeth chattering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will I see? His eyes say it all.      Enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gesturing the depth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lie down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to be fully submerged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For how long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as it takes.     Here -- John cups the back of her neck, holds her face just above the water as she lowers down. Her breathing is picking up. John leans over the tub, looks straight down at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last chance... (off her look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a deep one.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela takes a deep breath, holds it. John pulls his hand away and she settles to the bottom, her eyes riveted on his the entire time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent John ripples above.     His hand grips her arm, skin to skin.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Angela lies there and panic sets in. She starts to surface but John pushes her head back to the bottom, holds it firm. Her eyes dart about. Air is running out. She can't hold her breath much longer. It's not working -- But the room's lighting begins to pulsate -- as if the current were ramping down. It slows to that dim half- light as -- JOHN'S EYES -- CLOSE.     A single blink. ANGELA is lying in now BOILING WATER, screaming for all of her life. Water muffles the sound but not the fury. Huge TUB SHUDDERS hard -- snapping out of the hold down bolts. John is stunned -- how powerful is this woman? Another SCREAM and the inch-thick TUB CRACKS.     Water starts streaming onto the tile. John lunges, grabs Angela and PULLS her up from the water -- her muffled SCREAMS SHATTERING the air as her mouth breaks the surface. She SLAMS hard against his chest -- arms wrapping tight -- fingers digging into his back -- leaving marks that might just scar. TUB GIVES WAY and the damn breaks. John and Angela go down -- hit the tile as one -- water washing over them both. ANGELA lies there on top of John. Trembling.      She loo up him, eyes filled with revelation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All those people... so sad... John nods, helping her understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I've always known... where the bad guys are... where to aim, when to duck... it's not luck... I've always known... Tears stream down her cheeks. John reaches out to touch her when her eyes CLAMP TIGHT in pain --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela? Eyes snap open and she's off him in a second, runs out. John pries himself from the tile, goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela runs behind the vertebrae of machines, dripping water the entire way. John tries to keep up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was rolling toward him -- not a ball -- something smaller. Shiny. She stops, kneels to the floor.     John walks up to join Something glints in the catch trough. She reaches down, plucks it up and brings an odd COIN INTO VIEW -- John's face contorts with rage as he takes the familiar coin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthazar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beeman's bowling bag is flipped and the contents are dumped onto a table. Powder, bugs and bullets go everywhere. John retrieves the odd-tipped bullets. Those brass knuckles and that copper pipe are taken also.

dialogues.speaker: CHRISTIAN RELICS
dialogues.text: are removed from a display cabinet. There's the pure platinum Flask of Divinity, the petrified husk from the River of Life -- the hollow shaft of an iron cross -- all striking pieces individually but when twisted and locked together form a very imposing --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swings the cross down, pours a pound of blasting powder into the husk -- chambers a special bullet into one of the ten barrels, snaps it shut -- turns and FIRES. BULLET leaves a trail of flame as it streaks across his endless apartment, blasts the center out of -- A carton of Lucky Strikes. SETTLE ON the Surgeon General's warning -- burning away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you kill him? What about the Balance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John is stuffing the bowling bag while Angela watches, now dressed in dry clothes. That shirt is John's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That half-breed tipped my scales when he started killing my friends. I'm just adding a little counterweight. John lifts that holy shotgun -- KA CHICK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about me?    I can't stay here forever. John turns to her -- locks on those eyes. He reaches into his coat pocket as he walks up to her. She shudders as his arms wrap around her face and for a beat they're cheek to cheek. When he pulls back she sees he has clipped Hennessey's AMULET around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think of it as a bulletproof vest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I'm going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (knows he can't win)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're staying in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAT-ASS TIRES BURN under the full torque of a 426 HEMI. A jet-black '70s BARRACUDA BLASTS from the basement garage of 20 Lanes -- slides onto the streets of L.A. Angela hangs on as John grabs the SKULL shifter knob -- slams into 2nd -- leaves another layer of tread behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLYING OVER the ocean, a 747 ROARS RIGHT OVER US. Dipping out of cloud cover, it reveals the coast of a sprawling metropolis stretched out miles below.

dialogues.speaker: L.A. LANDMARKS
dialogues.text: streak PAST. The Big Donut, the occult bookstores, the '57 Chevy sign, that Mission in the park. This is actually the POV FROM John's Barracuda. He downshifts -- DRIFTS PAST a building with a facade of pre-stressed concrete and huge gold letters -- "BZR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This shouldn't take long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elevator opens and John steps out into a lobby of concrete and glass. Pretentious design screams money. Lots of it. Since trading is still a half hour away, the place is practically empty. Across the room a stainless steal DOOR HISSES open. John looks the other way as a Security Guard exits. Thick DOOR glides closed, seals with another HISS. No way in. John notices the janitor down one hallway. It's Nico from Midnite's. He and John lock stares. Nico opens a "Security Only" door, steps inside -- leaves the door open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Monitors are powering up around the room. A few of those Young Businessmen we last saw at Midnite's are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, early bird is a fat bird, know what I'm sayin'? Balthazar walks through, looking every bit like the smug and successful businessman he is. He stops at a LONG MIRROR on one wall. Adjusts his collar, his hair. His "look."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we pushing today, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip Morris. As Balthazar admires himself, his reflection distorts slightly. The demon in him? He touches his face, does a vowel stretch. His face distorts even further. That's got him moving closer to the mirror. Balthazar's concerned because now his skin appears in motion, rippling as if liquefied. And just when he sees the surface of the mirror BLISTERING and starts to move --

dialogues.speaker: BOOOM --
dialogues.text: One way GLASS EXPLODES outward on the front edge of a FIREBALL -- sending Balthazar flying with glass and flame. John stands on the other side in an ACCESS CHANNEL -- that Dragon's breath flamethrower now duct-taped to his holy shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing it? John steps into the trading room, eyes Balthazar rising from the floor. Suit's in shreds, half his face is burned off, but now he's pissed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is in direct violation of the Balance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Screw the Balance. John hits him with another BLAST of FLAME -- pins him hard against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Balthazar's young turks attack. One leaps over the trading station. John swings around -- aims the SHOTGUN -- BOOM -- half-breed is blasted midair. The other turk seems to defy gravity as he scampers across the ceiling. John aims up -- PUMPS SEVERAL ROUNDS -- steps out of the way as a body falls, smashes into a desk. BOOM -- BOOM -- that'll keep it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela hears the GUNSHOTS. Cop instinct takes over and she gets out of the car. Checks the amulet. Intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns his attention back to Balthazar, doesn't hesitate and hits him with a continuous tide of flame. Suit and skin is peeling off, revealing something else underneath. The true form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's he doing it, you half-breed shit?! John swings the flame aside so he can KICK Balthazar against the wall. But now his WEAPON SPUTTERS. Shit. Charcoal hand thrusts out, bats away the shotgun and grabs John by the throat. Balthazar rises from the ashes.     He may be burned, but he's one tough son of a bitch. Balthazar slides    John up a wall by his neck. John can' break his hold.     He's choking, frantically rummages through his coat    pockets. Comes out with those sacred GOLD KNUCKLES on    his right hand. Balthazar tightens his grip and John swings, clocks him across the face. The enhanced punch sends a dizzying ripple throughout Balthazar's body. But he doesn't let go. John is choking, starts whaling on him. Again and again -- each punch weakening this demon more. John finally gets him against the wall. Right arm's tired so he slips the gold knuckles onto his left hand, and with extreme pleasure -- continues punching away. Drives Balthazar to the floor, right to the brink of death.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He leans up, winded. Watches in delight as Balthazar strains to take his final breaths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will see you very soon...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not really, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't cheat it this time... you're going back to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True.   But you're not. John removes that small BLACK BOX from his coat. Balthazar tries not to be concerned until John unlatches it and removes the one weapon he hardly ever uses -- A Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm reading you your last rites. Balthazar reacts.      This isn't good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your remedial incantations have no relevance to my kind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you half human? Balthazar doesn't have to answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, that makes you eligible to be forgiven. You do know what it is to truly be forgiven? To be welcomed into the kingdom of God? Balthazar's worst nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A demon in heaven -- love to be a fly on that wall...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a priest, you have no power...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I escaped hell, who else do you know that has the power to do that?! Balthazar is now doubting his own beliefs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me how Mammon is crossing over and you can go back to your shithole. Balthazar isn't convinced. John stands -- raises the Bible and starts to read --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'May the merciful God have mercy on you and grant you the pardon of all your sins...' He places a hand on Balthazar's forehead. Balthazar glares at it as John's voice rises with commanding authority.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Whosoever sins you remit on earth they are remitted unto them in heaven. I absolve you from -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It may not even work...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?   How's he doing it?! Balthazar looks scared as shit to tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (bellowing out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Grant your child entry into thy kingdom in the name of the Father, and the Son and the Holy Gh -- '

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... Sangre de dio. John is stunned -- did he hear right?     Balthazar nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What killed the Son of God will give birth to the son of the devil. John's mind races and he finally puts it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's found the Spear. Balthazar's expression confirms it.

dialogues.speaker: THE PRISONER'S RELIC
dialogues.text: It's tucked between the folds of an AIRLINES blanket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over com)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, we've been cleared for landing. Please make sure your seats are in their upright and locked position. Hand COMES IN, grips the relic.      WIDEN to see...

dialogues.speaker: INT. 747
dialogues.text: Prisoner in an aisle seat, trying to keep calm. He looks behind him as if being watched. Just nerves again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over com)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should be on the ground in Los Angeles within ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGELA moves through the gathered crowd looking up at the building. As she makes her way through, the amulet brushes against bodies -- swinging from side to side. Angela suddenly stops in the center of the street, turns...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something's coming... She stares at her surroundings with an increasing sense of dread. Then hears the RUMBLE and TIRES SCREECHING.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela spins, spots John's BARRACUDA exploding around the corner. It barrels up the street and slides to a SQUEALING stop in front of her. Passenger door swings open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to staying in the car?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were in danger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now there's a premonition. SIRENS crack the air.     Angela jumps in and John PEELS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Balthazar is taking his last breaths when the sound of WIND filters through the room. He looks up as a shadow drapes across him. Eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One more chance... Shadow darkens and his decimated form shudders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus didn't die from being nailed to a cross.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John takes a turn at 70 as Angela stares into John's Bible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was finished off by a soldier's spear. He points in the Bible at a detailed painting of the event -- Jesus hanging on the cross -- being pierced by a soldier's spear. It matches that child's drawing John removed from the fridge -- now lying on his seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Catholic, John -- I know the crucifixion story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you know what this spear would mean to a demon trying to cross over. She doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The stains on its edges? Angela looks back at the painting, notes the liquid flowing from Jesus' wound. Angela can't believe it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammon needed divine assistance -- how's the blood of God's only son? Angela sits stunned for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's it -- he's got everything he needs to escape...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not quite. (glances at her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twins. Angela gives him a look.       Something in the rearview mirror catches his gaze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here we go -- John floors it and Angela glances out the back window, spots something in the traffic -- bounding over vehicles, hitting the pavement on all fours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hound on the hunt. A blur of muscle and bone leaps over cars at incredible speed -- denting in roofs, CRACKING a WINDSHIELD -- causing general chaos. Cars brake -- SLIDE into each other. And still this thing keeps coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on -- BARRACUDA slides into an alley, races toward the other end.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela looks back, sees their pursuer enter the alley. It makes huge strides along the walls, defying all manner of physics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Impossible. The beast goes right up the wall and disappears above the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lost it. BAM, something lands hard on the roof, denting it a good foot. A huge clawed TALON punches into the sheet metal, starts shredding it right over Angela. Talon thrusts in. Angela dodges it -- her amulet swinging wildly. John HITS the BRAKES and the beast flips off the roof and onto the hood -- right INTO VIEW. A muscular anomaly with eyes that are unmistakably Balthazar's. He lashes against the windshield with an extra appendage. Thank God for safety glass. He jerks back his embedded talon, pulls the entire windshield out with it, smashing it on the hood. GLASS PARTICLES EXPLODE into the car. John throws the car into a spin, slamming the Barracuda into several parked cars. Balthazar is uprooted, is thrown from the car. Angela looks back, sees Balthazar rolling into traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not down.   Gimme your phone. Angela pulls out her cellular.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BRITISH COUPLE sit in the back of Chaz's taxi, staring out at the seedy side of town as if it were "Wild Kingdom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They mark their territory with graffiti instead of urine but they're still very much animals. British woman takes documentary photos. Chaz's CELLULAR RINGS over the BUZZ of a dispatch SCANNER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a private line -- John?! INTERCUT JOHN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz -- where are you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah... 3rd and Figueroa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You still got that Sedrallus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (glancing to couple)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I'm kind of busy right now, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Chaz, I'm trying to save my ass here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (under his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What else is new...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember the Chalic of Enook incident?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (remembering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no, no, no, not that, I just paid off this car!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: West side of the 3rd Street Bridge, say... He checks the speedometer -- 90 mph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... 2 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm five blocks away! (as John CLICKS off)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John? John?! Ah... shit. Chaz downshifts, stops in cloud of dust --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, tour's over. The British start to argue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads toward the skyline now -- at 90 mph -- to the 3rd Street Bridge on the horizon. Angela scans behind them, can't believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's back. Here comes Balthazar through traffic on all fours --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John, he's back and he's gaining!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he's gaining. John PUNCHES the GAS to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaz swerves onto the other side of the narrow bridge. He SCREECHES TO A STOP across the roadway -- opens the glove box, grabs a velvet-wrapped object and pulls a glass vial out of it. Inside flows a phosphorescent green liquid. Chaz jumps out, runs to the back of the car, pauses when he hears the sound of a STRAINING ENGINE. Here comes the topless Barracuda over the bridge's arched roadway. And what the hell is that running behind it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- shit -- shit --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Chaz twists off the gas cap, drops the vial into the tank He pulls out his BEEPER, rips the cover off, exposing the electronics. He wedges the beeper into the tank inlet, then starts sprinting off the bridge while --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John gives Angela the number.
Taxi in view.     Angela punches in the number --
They RIP past the taxi --
Here comes Balthazar up the bridge. Like a supercharged cheetah, running full stride. And not even winded.
Balthazar is almost to the taxi -- John waits -- then --
Angela punches the last digit as -- -- Balthazar LEAPS to jump the taxi --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEEPER CONTACTS BUZZ -- spark -- GAS IGNITES --

dialogues.speaker: TAXI
dialogues.text: EXPLODES right under Balthazar in a tremendous FIREBALL. Initial impact only kicks him higher. It's when the Sedrallus in the tank truly ignites that the real FIREWORKS begin.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Balthazar is caught in a haze of brilliant red particles that tear his body apart in midair. His final SHRIEK is chilling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John smacks the wheel, victoriously -- looks over to Angela who sighs with relief. His expression changes as he centers on the empty necklace dangling around her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the amulet? WHAM -- something reaches through the roof hole and JERKS HER right out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: John SLAMS the BRAKES home -- car spins and John is already jumping out before it comes to a stop. He runs to the rail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (running up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?! Both leap onto the concrete rail, lean over and spot a HUGE WINGED SHADOW just as it disappears below the bridge. Chaz is speechless as he turns to John. This is too much. John gives him the out he's been waiting for --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're even. Chaz nods and John leaves him at the rail.   He jumps bac in the BARRACUDA and PEELS OUT. Chaz watches him race away, looks back at his burning taxi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prisoner walks out of the terminal, here at last. He stares at all the vehicles at his disposal. A family crowds around the back of a minivan. Wife hugs the dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watches him from behind.    Prisoner turns, looks back, suspiciously. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: PRISONER
dialogues.text: walks out to the street, slides into the minivan, tears away. Kids' toys tumble across the seats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John bursts through a door -- Midnite right on his heels. MIDNITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammon has been trying to climb out of his father's shadow for eons. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this time he might just make it. MIDNITE (unconvinced)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because he's got the Spear? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the bridge. MIDNITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're giving this girl way too much credit. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't know her. MIDNITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you do?   That would be a first. John swings open a STORAGE ROOM DOOR -- looks in at large-scale relics -- statues, props, etc. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the chair? MIDNITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair? JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The delicate little number from Sing Sing?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Midnite just stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fine line that separates a hero from a fool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take my chances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And taint my establishment with your blood? I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnite --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that device can do to the ill-equipped --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnite --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and even in your most glorious days your brain was never your most powerful attribute --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the hell is the chair, you dumb shit?! Midnite just stands there -- his body inflating past it's seven feet. John knows he went too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the cancer talking, you know that, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds up his finger)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once. John nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fluorescents flicker, REVEAL boxes of toilet tissue, cooking supplies, etc. And sitting in one corner by the huge power transformer is --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: -- the chair. Heavy wooden monstrosity with straps and cuffs and the wear of many who sat in it for the last time. Yeah, it's an electric chair right out of Sing Sing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's in your bathroom, a Renoir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have insurance issues. John clears off the seat, starts to sit.        Midnite b him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You haven't surfed in decades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like riding a bike... He tries again.     Midnite blocks him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll be lucky to reach an elemental plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just increase the juice. John tries again.     Again Midnite stops him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In your condition your body won't take much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just need enough rope to find her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And if you do -- what then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One goddamn problem at a time -- John shoves past him, plops his ass in the huge chair. His feet dangle off the ground. Midnite stands by, won't help. So John starts strapping himself in the chair. His chest, his ankles. One wrist. He obviously can't strap the other. He looks to the big man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to sign a waiver?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Midnite sighs -- finally straps the other wrist in -- pulls it TIGHT. Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on, Angela.

dialogues.speaker: ANGELA
dialogues.text: moving in a surreal fashion across an evening sky. Below her the City of Angels sweep past. Her eyes drift open and widen in horror as she sees beyond reality --

dialogues.speaker: REFLECTION IN HER EYES
dialogues.text: The city is ON FIRE. It's a repeat of Isabel's prophetic vision before she jumped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to my voice inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnite kneels in front of John who is now handcuffed to the chair, cables draped from every limb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll try and guide you out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammon was forced out of that girl when she jumped so unless he found a holding vessel to wait in, he would have fallen back to Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's still here.   I'm sure of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then watch yourself. He could be in anyone out there. John nods. Midnite lifts a palm of INSECT WINGS in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roach wings? What happened to using lilac pedals -- ?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Midnite cranks the JUICE on the panel as he BLOWS and Joh reacts as if being hit by a blast of wind. His head slams back against the slats. His skin ripples from the force. STAY ON his face as the sound of POWER courses through Jo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter do caelis, Deus, misere nobis. Fili Redemptor mundi, Deus, Miserere nobis... A FLASH turns into a streak behind John's face -- stretching to infinity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find the possessor and the Spear will be revealed... find them... find them and follow... The flash whips back TOWARD us and John is suddenly somewhere else. He looks O.S.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FROM that MYSTERIOUS POV, we watch the Prisoner hold the Spear for the first time. Like before, he turns and looks behind him where -- John now stands. Watching.      John centers on the Spear the Prisoner's hand.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH AHEAD
dialogues.text: That same MYSTERIOUS POV of the Prisoner in line.      He turns as he did before and it's -- -- John behind him.     Watching.   Prisoner turns away.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH AHEAD
dialogues.text: MYSTERIOUS POV is ON the Prisoner at the exit doors. looks back, suspiciously, and there's - John.   Watching.    Prisoner turns, heads to the minivan

dialogues.speaker: FLASH AHEAD
dialogues.text: of a minivan still smoking from a recent impact against a large iron ENTRANCE GATE. Prisoner is running from it, glances back --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: John is there. Watches as the Prisoner enters the abandoned wing of -- Ravenscar. John reacts. How did he miss this?

dialogues.speaker: FLASH AHEAD
dialogues.text: Fifty beds with fifty patients. Asleep. The Prisoner kneels next to one of the beds. John walks over, touches him and he rocks to the floor. Dead. Body reveals the Spear on the blanket of the bed. John reaches out to touch it when the boy BARRY suddenly SITS UP from under the blanket and grabs him by the throat. NOTE the boy's BLACKENED FINGERNAILS. John struggles to pull him off but the boy's grip is locked tight. John grabs at his hands -- chokes out the name -- JOHN

dialogues.speaker: MIDNITE
dialogues.text: John's hands suddenly become MIDNITE'S as his ally pulls him back into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's face is held tight in the life-saving fingers of Midnite's grip. John gasps as he comes back -- nods to Midnite and finally --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ravenscar. The abandoned wing. He's in the boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINGED SHADOW glides across the landscape, sweeps across manicured grounds and rises to reveal Ravenscar Hospital.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Midnite piles ASSAULT RIFLES, SHOTGUNS, GLOCKS onto a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know these won't kill them. John adjusts the flames of a butane heater under a pan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You probably won't even get close enough to use them. In the pan is that RELIGIOUS RELIC he brought from India. It's now MELTING. Midnite has trouble watching it dissolve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And it's not just the boy. John coughs, pours the melted gold into several small casting blocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better worry about whoever's helping him. John gives the big guy a glance, dips one of the castings into a pot of water -- HISSSSSS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As much as I admire your blind faith even in the most dire situations -- expecting to just waltz into a facility that is about to become the floodgate of Hell is reaching a bit, even for you. John stops the work, centers on him and Midnite just knows what he's thinking. Midnite sighs, heavily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I suppose two fools can die just as easily as one. John almost smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you think I'm trusting you to save the world? John taps the casting and out falls a GOLD-TIPPED BULLET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we're going to need more than a few magic bullets to get inside. John centers on the Sparkletts bottles positioned around the room. Just like John's. Hmmmm...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That ritual you do with the water, can you do more than one bottle at a time? Midnite raises an eyebrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The motorized MAIN GATE is jammed -- opening and closing on a crashed VAN. The van the Prisoner carjacked. The abandoned hospital wing stands ominous against a moonlit night. Vague figures move about near the emergency entrance. John's BARRACUDA IDLES up with its headlights off. John stares out, points up to the WATER TANK -- on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Therapy machines look like medieval torture devices in the dimly-lit room. BARRY stands waist deep in a large hydrotherapy tank inset into the tile floor. His skin is pale, sickly looking. Obviously containing Mammon takes its toll. Especially on a child. His hands are below his waist and now we see they're lowering a still-unconscious Angela into the water. Her face floats just above the surface as he buckles restraining straps around her wrists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front glass doors swing open and John and Midnite calmly strut inside. Stop. HEAR the O.S. MURMURS of an unseen crowd. This EMERGENCY ROOM is crammed with people. Lawyers. Brokers. Soccer moms. Truck drivers. Etc... Most are crowded in front of a set of double doors. Room goes dead silent as all eyes lock on our guys. John steps from Midnite, raises his hands like a riot cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay -- let's cut the scratch and call it a night. Meeting's over. That's got their attention. As entertainment. A few chuckle. John is surprised to see Ellie stepping from the crowd. Still that bundle of sexual energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ellie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, John, you know how much I love it on this side. This was just an opportunity to make it permanent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think his son will be any different? He'll just turn this place into his own Hell and then where will you to party, Heaven?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No need to get nasty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never bothered you before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so going to miss our little trysts. Ellie steps closer.     The crowd starts to close in with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you will. John pulls out his lighter, holds it up -- flicks it on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now turn around and take your friends with you. Can he look more ridiculous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will deport you.   All of you. You know I can. John steps back up onto a chair, thrusts the lighter higher --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, John, this is embarrassing. Where is your pride? -- right under a SPRINKLER HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to Hell. Ellie looks up just as the sprinklers trigger.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Ellie and a room of half-humans -- all looking up as water sprays from every nozzle. John and Midnite tense because the first drops have no effect. A beat -- a SPURT in the waterlines and suddenly -- SHRIEKS fill the room as half human skin begins to FRY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy water! Emergency lighting has snapped on -- throwing the room into a strobing nightmare of action. Flashes of human skin melting, revealing snippets of the true demons underneath. It's total pandemonium as their rage is directed toward the only real humans in the room. John and Midnite fling their coats open -- draw their WEAPONS and starts FIRING away at the attacking horde. Sacred bullets cause major damage -- wounds that ripple out through demon bodies. John and Midnite slam back to back -- spinning under the protective shield of a showering sprinkler head -- shooting at all manner of distorted forms that venture into the COLUMN OF SPRAY. One reloads while the other FIRES. It's a hellish form of a turkey shoot. Nothing sacred, nothing spared. John goes for the double doors. Midnite covers him -- blows away another two disintegrating demons. Two come up behind and he spins, takes them down. JOHN gets to the doors, starts to open them when Ellie jumps onto his back -- nails digging in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going back there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are what we are, Ellie -- John FIRES over his back, loosens her grip. He grabs hold, shoves her face up into the spray of an overhead sprinkler head. Legs flail about. Midnite comes out of the rain -- grabs John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go. John drops Ellie to the floor. No more pretty face -- no face at all -- yet the screams still come. John and Midnite get to the doors -- shove through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela's body and face are completely submerged now. She comes to, sees Barry above her -- tries to rise but the boy pushes her head to the bottom, holds it there. Last bubbles are floating up from her mouth. Barry places his other hand on her arm, closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy rain has stopped in here. A fine mist floats in the air. John and Midnite make their way through. Only their footsteps on the tile break the stark silence. Another set of doors is ahead. Before they reach it a faint shadow crosses in the mist. Both pause, expecting something to reveal itself. But it doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Faint waves undulate Barry's skin -- ripple from his chest, down his arms and into a submerged Angela. Every muscle in her body tenses in stark relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry's image ripples above her in silence. Room lighting starts to pulse -- slower and slower and when it's caught in that dim half-light -- Angela JOLTS and this time we CROSS OVER INTO --

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPY ROOM HELL
dialogues.text: Angela is lying in a bone-dry tank, lifts her head up to see a room not much different than the one she just left. Except for the SOUND. That low DRONE RISING IN PITCH -- those DEMONIC SCREECHES scratching at the walls. And now those INKY splotches begin consuming the color and light from the walls. Moving in on Angela. Closer and closer -- whatever's coming is just about on her. MAMMON (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela. Angela SPINS and for a split second comes face to face with the hideous form of MAMMON. She SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John and Midnite burst into the room, spot Barry standing in the tank. His hands in the water. On Angela. JOHN (rushing toward him)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barry! Barry looks up, sees the two men rushing toward him. Guns aimed. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her up!!   Let her up!! A beat as John meets Barry's eyes -- realizes he's staring at a frightened child. Barry backs away as -- -- Angela sits up behind John.    Water rippling off, straps dangling free. John turns -- locks on her BLACK EYES. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit -- John thinks fast -- scans the area and sees every mirror in the room has been shattered. So much for the quick fix. He jumps into the water with her, grabs her face and pushes her against the tank walls. This is an exorcism on the fly. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amar natash bow basar! Rescind from the flesh I command thee --

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Angela's eyes snap open -- dark and dilated. John sees it -- clasps a hand over her mouth -- cutting off her air supply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to Hell, asshole -- Her body undulates as Mammon's shape tries to come throug Pulsating through her arms, her chest -- her face. Angela BITES into his palm. John recoils. She shoves him off and John hits the tile hard. Angela jumps from the tank, pushes past in a blur. John spins to see Midnite standing right there -- Angela now firmly in his size-twelve grasp.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to John)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finish it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John coughs, struggles to stand. He tries to cover but it's obvious his end is nearing. Midnite positions Angela to face him, braces her arms out from her sides -- crucifixion-style. She tries but can't break free. John puts a hand to her forehead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Et separatur a plasmate tuo, Ut num quam laedatur amorsu antiqui serpentes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rescind from the flesh I command thee -- Amar natash bow basar! Angela's body stops fighting. The darkness in her eyes and fingernails begins to fade. It's working... Midnite is suddenly JERKED backwards with an agonizing YELL. Angela is dropped, slips into unconsciousness. John watches in horror as Midnite's 300-pound frame is lifted right off the floor by an INVISIBLE GRASP, slammed into the ceiling, then twisted and thrown with incredible force against the floor. Midnite glares at John, tries to speak.     But the words die on his lips.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Enraged, John scans the empty room, sees a large SHADOW on the ceiling that doesn't belong to any object. He holds back a cough long enough to rip up his sleeves and slams those tattoos together --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the light I command thee! Into the light I command thee! It takes every ounce of John's life force to keep this spell alive and when he's about to drop from exhaustion the shadow is brought fully into the light -- becomes that familiar shape of WINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your ego is astounding. John strains to see the shadow become the real thing -- the majestic wings of an angel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gabriel? John is too weak to even be surprised anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Figures... Gabriel touches down in front of him.       Spear in his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the wicked shall inherit the Earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You presume to judge me, John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betrayal, murder, genocide?    Call me provincial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am seeking to inspire humankind to be all that was intended.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By unleashing Hell on Earth?     Good thinking... Gabriel's wings fold behind as he walks around John.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've had it too easy for too long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's a few thousand years of pain, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never deserved to be blessed. You've all been born with a silver spoon in your mouth, never really appreciating the gift you were given so freely -- unconditional love from your creator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that just bugs the shit out of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not your fault. Like the animals you are, you never learn unless sufficiently prodded. Pleasure has no lasting effect. But subject you to pain, unpleasantness -- suffering -- and you will take notice, you will fight to overcome, to earn your redemption. That is when you're at your best. Angela's fingernails are starting to darken once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying to teach us a lesson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm giving you the chance to rise above the suffering and truly earn the love of God. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The road to salvation begins tonight. Right now. John just stares at this rogue angel, centers on the Spear in his hand. He makes a break for it. Gabriel's wings beat once. The GUST BLOWS John through the double doors, back into the --

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: -- where he smashes against a mesh-screened window, drops to the floor in a heap with the other dying carcasses.

dialogues.speaker: PHYSICAL THERAPY ROOM
dialogues.text: Gabriel turns back to Angela. He approaches her -- his rippling wings sliding up around her, enveloping her -- pulling her in. Those eyes of his could melt Dracula.

dialogues.speaker: CORRIDOR
dialogues.text: can't even stand, let alone save the girl.     Or humanit It would be so easy to give up. To roll over and die. But instead, he tries something he hasn't done in a long time. JOHN (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... I know I'm not one of your favorites... I'm not even allowed in your house these days... but I could use a little attention... John waits for nothing.
